website_summaries.verdict: The Swift 1 is cheap, looks nice and has a good battery -- just don't give it anything more difficult to do than web browsing.
pros: The Acer Swift 1 is a thin, lightweight budget-friendly laptop that has a few higher-end features that make it a more attractive deal than competing systems at its $329 price
Battery life is good at more than 9 hours
cons: Its low-end components mean it can't do much beyond basics and its limited storage will likely require some external option

customer_reviews.title: Good overall laptop
customer_reviews.text: I really like this laptop. I got it on the estimated time without any delay. So far the performance of the laptop is good, display is good and the audio is good too. It's not heavy and it has a premium look to it. It's an exceptional laptop for students on a budget or for light use, I got an external hard drive to supplement storage cause you dont get much with this laptop. I would recommend for anyone to get one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just about 2 years old when recieved 05/12/2020
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to find out this Computer was just about 2 years old, had windows 10 v1607 WOW ancient. and I bet the battery isn't any good either. I guess Ill know real soon if I have to return this. Most likely Acer wont warranty this at all since its 2 years old already.
customer_reviews.author: CCSS

customer_reviews.title: Okay for basic internet needs
customer_reviews.text: My 77 year old mom uses it pretty much for email, news, and facebook. It's okay for your basic internet needs. Don't expect much more from it. It's plugged in all the time so I don't know about battery life. I personally wouldn't buy it but it fine for my mom who hardly saves any files and just browse the internet a little every day.
customer_reviews.author: RawKing

customer_reviews.title: WIFI does not work
customer_reviews.text: Had to add a usb dongle (very small one) to get wifi; it appears to be Microsoft blocking the adapter, did updates, not sure which MS update screwed it up; assuming its microsoft because Edge was the only browser that work and that was sporadic.. The computer otherwise is a bargain, small foot print, sensitive track pad, good screen clarity. Added a 128G USB dongle (very small) for more storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact notebook. The 13 inch screen is just big enough for viewing and the keyboard is large enough for tapping comfortably. It's light weight makes it good for travel.
customer_reviews.author: nellemb20

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the price
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that there is an Acer pop-up that comes up every time you turn the laptop on, and I have not been able to disable it. Apart from that, for the price, I have been very pleased with this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: AsiaM

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this laptop. It is so portable. It is very lightweight and the battery life is very good. I use this computer for online claases so it has not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MARY GUEH

customer_reviews.title: This is a cheap made computer
customer_reviews.text: We bought this computer for our Daughter’s Birthday and just gave it to her a month ago and it just stopped working. A blank screen. She is back to using her old computer but this does not solve the problem of her needing a new one for college use.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a relatively cheap laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Had to ship it back for repair 4 months after I got it because of repeated screen freezes. Got it back fixed, but now end-of-service message (dated August 2018) appears every time I turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Good for students
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for college, it's nice and portable. Only issue was that some of the metal around the USB ports has warped from being in a crappy backpack, but it doesn't affect the usability. Battery lasts long enough for me but sometimes can run low on big assignments. Overall, I am really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as it looks
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know if I would like the smaller screen but it is good for traveling update only lasted 3 months totally dead
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Good in the beginning, Wears down fast
customer_reviews.text: This laptop was really great for the first two weeks but has become increasingly slow and dies really fast. It has really weird glitches and the webpages constantly crash. I was expecting a lot more
customer_reviews.author: Isabella Joy

customer_reviews.title: wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted something that she could work from home on. Her comments were excellent battery life and really quick. Excellent value for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Schleier

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this laptop for approx 2 months. I am pretty pleased with my purchase thus far. Classes just started for me. As a result, I am going to wait a few more months before I post a thorough review.
customer_reviews.author: carmen benjamin

customer_reviews.title: It is affordable, sleek and light weight. I love it
customer_reviews.text: I got my Acer swift 1 yesterday. It looks clean, works great and I love it's sleekness for a laptop at its price.
customer_reviews.author: Patience

customer_reviews.title: It's fast and thin
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, so thin and so fast. It's like working with a tablet. If you need to work with office apps and browse the web then this is the right product.
customer_reviews.author: grommelvilla

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Extremely slow, even for a budget computer. I've resorted to using my phone for simple internet browsing because this computer struggles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable for it's price
customer_reviews.text: My wife really likes it. Extended rom with 250gb M.2 SSD and it runs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: igor

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great deal! Perfect as new, it’s arrived early, all ok
customer_reviews.author: Adriano Petronelli

product_meta.title: Acer Swift 13.3" Full HD Intel Quad Core N4200 2.5GHz 4GB 64GB eMMC Webcam Bluetooth Fingerprint Reader Windows 10 Pure Silver
product_meta.description: Acer Swift 1 is gorgeous inside and out. The narrow-bezeled Full HD¹ IPS screen perfectly matches the sleek, all-mental body,¹ delivering stunning visuals with vibrant color and bright clarity. Vastly customizable configuration and a fast wireless connection let you breeze through daily tasks with the unbeatable joy of wireless freedom. The versatile laptop further streamlines your day with a load of exciting features, including Fingerprint Reader, Windows Hello, Cortana and more. With up to 20 hours of battery life and power-off charging, you can finish your day with confidence—even if you're away from an outlet.
feature_bullets: Acer Swift 1 Ultrabook Pure Silver featured fingerprint reader;
13.3" Full HD IPS Anti-Glare ComfyView LED Backlit Display (1920 x 1080) | HD Webcam and HD stereo speakers;
Quad-Core Intel Pentium N4200 (1.1GHz - 2.5GHz) with Intel HD Graphics 505;
4GB DDR3L SDRAM 1600MHz | 64GB eMMC flash drive | Built in WiFi 802.11 ac | Bluetooth 4.0| Windows 10 OS;
SD card reader | 1 x USB 2.0 | 2 x USB 3.0 | 1 x USB-C 3.1 | HDMI.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars45 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
